p: With their unique nanostructural properties, these materials are used in many key industries, such as pharmaceuticals, electronics, cosmetology, medicine, environmental protection, textiles, and packaging. They are also applied in biotechnology, and recently, in plant in vitro cultures [ 9]. Nanosilver is used in plant in vitro cultures at the culture initiation stage to prevent contaminations, offering a viable alternative to antibiotics used in plant micropropagation [ 10].
